meanings.definition: To be in a state of disrepair or malfunction.
meanings.sent1: The old car pooched on the side of the road.
meanings.sent2: The computer pooched right before the important presentation.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot pooched and started dancing in circles.
meanings.sent4: His plan pooched like a balloon popping suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The leaky faucet pooched water all over the kitchen floor.

meanings.definition: To have failed or been unsuccessful.
meanings.sent1: She pooched the exam and felt disappointed.
meanings.sent2: The team pooched the game after a series of mistakes.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to bake a cake pooched when he forgot the flour.
meanings.sent4: Their negotiation pooched like a deflated balloon.
meanings.sent5: The rocket launch pooched due to technical issues.

meanings.definition: To be exhausted or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, he felt completely pooched.
meanings.sent2: The dog pooched after playing fetch all day.
meanings.sent3: She pooched on the couch after a busy day at work.
meanings.sent4: The old engine pooched after running for hours.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner was pooched at the finish line.
